Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop

Class DatagramClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.DatagramConnector
      • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.DatagramClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ChannelHandler
    public abstract class DatagramClient
extends DatagramConnector
implements ChannelHandler
    A client that sends and receives datagrams to/from a specific remote address.

    DatagramClient uses a "connected" DatagramChannel, which means all datagrams are sent to and received from a single remote address. This provides some efficiency benefits and allows the use of simpler read/write operations.

    Subclasses implement receive(ByteBuffer) to handle incoming datagrams and can use send(ByteBuffer) to send data.

    For DTLS-secured connections, encryption and decryption are handled transparently.

    Example usage: 

    
 public class SimpleDNSClient extends DatagramClient {

     public SimpleDNSClient(String server) throws UnknownHostException {
         super(server, 53);
     }

     @Override
     protected void receive(ByteBuffer data) {
         DNSMessage response = DNSMessage.parse(data);
         // Process response...
     }

     public void query(DNSMessage query) {
         send(query.serialize());
     }

     @Override
     protected String getDescription() {
         return "dns-client";
     }
 }
    Author:
    Chris Burdess

      • open

        public void open()
          throws java.io.IOException
        Opens the datagram channel and connects to the remote address. The channel is registered with a SelectorLoop for event-driven I/O.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the channel cannot be opened

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes the datagram channel.

      • receive

        protected abstract void receive​(java.nio.ByteBuffer data)
        Called when a datagram is received from the remote. For DTLS connections, the data is already decrypted.
        Parameters:
        data - the datagram payload

      • send

        public void send​(java.nio.ByteBuffer data)
        Sends a datagram to the remote. For DTLS connections, the data is automatically encrypted.
        Parameters:
        data - the datagram payload
